N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16 ยง 257.6 - Instrumentation and electrical services

State Regulations
(a) Provision shall be made for the continued
operation, in an emergency, of those systems which are required to be operative
for the fail-safe or safe-standby condition of the plant. (b) Electric power supply. Secondary standby
electric power supply either from a second feed or on-site power shall be
provided in new and existing plants adequate to maintain service to facilities
such as, but not limited to, fire detection and protection systems, vital
instrumentation, and emergency controls in order to insure a fail-safe or safe
standby condition at all times. (c) Fail-safe alternate. Where a gas corporation can demonstrate that a plant will
shut down in a fail-safe condition in the event of power failure, the
requirements in subdivision (a) of this section for secondary standby electric
power supply is not mandatory. Notes
